definition: a deviation from what is normal or expected
sentence: The aberration in the data was caused by a faulty sensor.

definition: hostile and aggressive
sentence: The belligerent customer argued with the cashier over a small mistake.

definition: a feeling of trust and friendship among people who spend a lot of time together
sentence: The camaraderie among the team members made the project enjoyable.

definition: polite submission and respect
sentence: Out of deference to his elders, he always let them speak first.

definition: cheerful and full of energy
sentence: Her ebullient personality lit up the room at the party.

definition: treating serious issues with deliberately inappropriate humor
sentence: His facetious remarks during the meeting annoyed the serious participants.

definition: fond of company; sociable
sentence: The gregarious host invited everyone to join the conversation.

definition: a system in which members of an organization or society are ranked according to relative status or authority
sentence: The company has a clear hierarchy from interns to executives.

definition: a person who attacks cherished beliefs or institutions
sentence: The iconoclast writer challenged traditional literary norms.

definition: the fact of two things being seen or placed close together with contrasting effect
sentence: The juxtaposition of the old building next to the modern skyscraper was striking.

definition: a tube-shaped optical instrument that is rotated to produce a succession of symmetrical designs
sentence: The kaleidoscope of colors in the sunset was mesmerizing.

definition: a complicated irregular network of passages or paths
sentence: The labyrinth of streets in the old city confused the tourists.

definition: generous or forgiving, especially towards a rival or less powerful person
sentence: The magnanimous leader forgave his opponent after the election.

definition: the lowest point in the fortunes of a person or organization
sentence: The company's stock reached its nadir during the recession.

definition: render obscure, unclear, or unintelligible
sentence: The politician tried to obfuscate the issue with complex jargon.

definition: a solution or remedy for all difficulties or diseases
sentence: There is no panacea for all the world's problems.

definition: representing the most perfect or typical example of a quality or class
sentence: She is the quintessential professional, always prepared and efficient.

definition: an exalted expression of feeling
sentence: The musician played a rhapsody that moved the audience to tears.

definition: having or showing keen mental discernment and good judgment
sentence: The sagacious advisor gave wise counsel to the king.

definition: reserved or uncommunicative in speech; saying little
sentence: The taciturn librarian rarely spoke unless asked a question.

definition: present, appearing, or found everywhere
sentence: Smartphones have become ubiquitous in modern society.

definition: regard with great respect
sentence: The community venerate their ancestors through annual ceremonies.

definition: a strong desire to travel
sentence: His wanderlust led him to explore every continent.
